name: 1,1':4',1''-Terphenyl
Reason: 1,1':4',1''-Terphenyl has a melting point of 100°C due to the presence of two phenyl rings linked in a linear fashion, which increases the molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, raising the melting point by approximately +20°C. Each additional phenyl group can be estimated to add approximately 100°C to the melting point due to increased pi-pi interactions, rigidity, and molecular weight.
